title: How much do artists actually get paid for their music? - Quora
tags: Salaries for Specific Jobs and Careers

response.answer_text: Well, this is difficult to answer, but I can tell you how they get paid. Artists generally get money from different sources. Most of it comes from concert tickets. Very little, if any at all comes from streams or record sales. If an artist is signed to a record label: Generally this is how it works. An artist signs a deal with a label and the label gives the artist an advance on their royalties so they can pay for the production of their first album. Let’s say this number is $100,000. Once the album is done, the record label releases it and the the royalties start to come in. The artist doesn’t get paid until their advance is recouped, which means, until the label gets their $100,000 back, the artist doesn’t see any money from the record. Even after that, the the artist and label split additional royalties. As you can imagine, it takes quite a lot of streams and music sales for the artist to start making money.

If you are signed with a recording company, you will get paid pennies from every dollar you sell. If you are an independent artist and you own your own home recording studio, you can record a CD (free). You can master it, free to a few hundred dollars. You can print a CD for about $1.25 each if you order a thousand. And sell each CD for $12 to $15 dollars per unit.
